Who am I? Politically, I'm left of center.

All of the privileges that I have, should be enjoyed by any human across the planet. There is no scarcity or other valid reason not to share evenly.

I'm a Linux Admin, an IT professional,

I was sad to see Mitt Romney decide not to run again - not because his opinions align with mine in any way, but because he's perhaps the very last of the Republicans who actually stayed above and outside the shitshow that the current Republican party has become. One could reason with him, to an extent, and make deals with him, to an extent. Now, all we have is the MAGAt crowd on one side, and the sensible people who at least make the effort to improve lives on the other side.

Dems aren't perfect, but I refuse to vote third-party at the national level, because even a passing thought of TFG coming back for another four years sends me into abject panic and terror.

Neuro-spicy. Aspie pretending (sometimes badly) to be human (at least, it often feels that way) while fighting depression and chronic insomnia. Aspiring mostly-SF writer, burned-out IT geek, humanist who wants to see us make at least a token effort to stop enshittifying our entire planet. Is there really anything so incredibly, soul-threateningly terrible about the idea of giving a shit about other people?


Something I said pissed you off? It may be a misunderstanding, I'm far from immune to foot-in-mouth disease. Please check with me before you assume it was malicious. It most likely wasn't. If I don't think you're someone worth talking to, I just won't talk to you in the first place, period.

Follow-backs: If you have something to say, sure. No posts? Nothing to say? What would be the point? In the words of @PatternChaser@mas.to, "I don't follow back, I follow interesting." I'm trying to keep the signal-to-noise ratio in my feed high. Still, if you follow me and I see it, I will do my best to at least find time to look. I can't guarantee I won't miss it, I'm not awake 24/7.
(And sorry, but don't expect me to follow you if you're posting the same dozen posts, day in, day out, day after day after week after month. In fact I'll most likely mute you.)

Came here to put words into my mouth so you could attack me over something I didn't say? (Yeah, sadly, it's happened.) Just don't. I WILL block your ass. Nobody has time for that shit.

Geek Stuff: I run Gentoo Linux, and I maintain a personal overlay with packages for dev-perl/Tk-MListbox, sys-apps/procmeter3, net-misc/icbm, media-sound/perljammer, app-crypt/sherpa, and app-editors/xnedit. Of those, net-misc/icbm and media-sound/perljammer are my own projects.

note:
What they say about people getting more moderate as they age... Yeah, not so much here... I'm farther to the left than ever, and beyond angry. I don't steep in that anger, I'm actively looking for ways to turn that energy into a positive force for change.

#CovidIsNotOver and the epidemic of gun deaths is certainly not over. The fight to get all people the same rights and privileges that I enjoy as a cis white male has barely even begun.

Politics aside, I tend to read history - most of the contemporary history I read is not focused on the US, as the last several decades of our politics have been toxic enough to live through. I've no desire to rehash that.

My BookWyrm is at https://b.djw.li/user/me - also a small instance.

A list of links is coming soon, so I don't have to keep updating bios every time I find a new Fediverse platform I'm enamored with!

Going to move my site to the shorter domain, I think, when I rebuild it - it's presently ugly to say the least.

Thank you for reading and supporting Interzone.

— Gareth Jelley, Editor & Publisher

Around 2016 I decided I needed to invent my own religion. I called it Demonkind, and I wrote a bunch of pages explaining and working out my philosophy. It was a valuable exercise for me. Basically nobody else responded to it in any way pro or con, not even a spam message. So I’m chalking it up to a good self education, and no longer pretending it’s “a thing”. If you’ve read this, I’m very surprised!
